distribution.text: Copyright 2023 SUSE LLC. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
This update of postgresql91 to 9.1.19 fixes the following issues:

* CVE-2015-5288: crypt() (pgCrypto extension) couldi potentially be exploited to read a few additional bytes of memory (bsc#949669)

Also contains all changes and bugfixes in the upstream 9.1.19 release:
http://www.postgresql.org/docs/9.1/static/release-9-1-19.html
notes.title: Description of the patch

full_product_name.name: postgresql91-devel-9.1.19-0.5.1.x86_64 as component of SUSE Studio Onsite 1.3

notes.text: The crypt function in contrib/pgcrypto in PostgreSQL before 9.0.23, 9.1.x before 9.1.19, 9.2.x before 9.2.14, 9.3.x before 9.3.10, and 9.4.x before 9.4.5 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (server crash) or read arbitrary server memory via a "too-short" salt.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
